verses.verse: When thou sittest<WH3427> to eat<WH3898> with a ruler<WH4910>, Consider<WH995> diligently<WH995> him that is before thee<WH6440>;
And put<WH7760> a knife<WH7915> to thy throat<WH3930>, If thou be a man given<WH1167> to appetite<WH5315>.
Be not desirous<WH183> of his dainties<WH4303>; Seeing they are deceitful<WH3577> food<WH3899>.
Weary <WH3021> not thyself to be rich<WH6238>; Cease<WH2308> from thine own wisdom<WH998>.
Wilt thou set<WH5774> thine eyes<WH5869> upon that which is not<WH6213>? For riches certainly make<WH6213> themselves wings<WH3671>, Like an eagle<WH5404> that flieth<WH5774> toward heaven<WH8064>.
Eat <WH3898> thou not the bread<WH3899> of him that hath an evil<WH7451> eye<WH5869>, Neither desire<WH183> thou his dainties<WH4303>:
For as he thinketh<WH8176> within<WH5315> himself<WH398>, so is he: Eat and drink<WH8354>, saith<WH559> he to thee<WH3820>; But his heart is not with thee.
The morsel<WH6595> which thou hast eaten<WH398> shalt thou vomit up<WH6958>, And lose<WH7843> thy sweet<WH5273> words<WH1697>.
Speak <WH1696> not in the hearing<WH241> of a fool<WH3684>; For he will despise<WH936> the wisdom<WH7922> of thy words<WH4405>.
Remove <WH5253> not the ancient<WH5769> landmark<WH1366>; And enter<WH935> not into the fields<WH7704> of the fatherless<WH3490>:
For their Redeemer<WH1350> is strong<WH2389>; He will plead<WH7378> their cause against thee<WH7379>.
Apply <WH935> thy heart<WH3820> unto instruction<WH4148>, And thine ears<WH241> to the words<WH561> of knowledge<WH1847>.
Withhold <WH4513> not correction<WH4148> from the child<WH5288>; For if thou beat<WH5221> him with the rod<WH7626>, he will not die<WH4191>.
Thou shalt beat<WH5221> him with the rod<WH7626>, And shalt deliver<WH5337> his soul<WH5315> from Sheol<WH7585>.
My son<WH1121>, if thy heart<WH3820> be wise<WH2449>, My heart<WH3820> will be glad<WH8055>, even mine<WH589>:
Yea <WH3629>, my heart will rejoice<WH5937>, When thy lips<WH8193> speak<WH1696> right things<WH4339>.
Let not thy heart<WH3820> envy<WH7065> sinners<WH2400>; But be thou in the fear<WH3374> of Jehovah<WH3068> all the day long<WH3117>:
For surely there is<WH3426> a reward<WH319>; And thy hope<WH8615> shall not be cut off<WH3772>.
Hear <WH8085> thou<WH1121>, my son, and be wise<WH2449>, And guide<WH833> thy heart<WH3820> in the way<WH1870>.
Be not among winebibbers<WH3196>, Among gluttonous eaters<WH2151> of flesh<WH1320>:
For the drunkard<WH5433> and the glutton<WH2151> shall come to poverty<WH3423>; And drowsiness<WH5124> will clothe<WH3847> a man with rags<WH7168>.
Hearken <WH8085> unto thy father<WH1> that begat<WH3205> thee<WH936>, And despise not thy mother<WH517> when she is old<WH2204>.
Buy <WH7069> the truth<WH571>, and sell<WH4376> it not<WH2451>; Yea, wisdom, and instruction<WH4148>, and understanding<WH998>.
The father<WH1> of the righteous<WH6662> will greatly<WH1524> rejoice<WH1523>; And he that begetteth<WH3205> a wise<WH2450> child will have joy of him<WH8055>.
Let thy father<WH1> and thy mother<WH517> be glad<WH8055>, And let her that bare<WH3205> thee rejoice<WH1523>.
My son<WH1121>, give<WH5414> me thy heart<WH3820>; And let thine eyes<WH5869> delight<WH7521> in my ways<WH1870>.
For a harlot<WH2181> is a deep<WH6013> ditch<WH7745>; And a foreign woman<WH5237> is a narrow<WH6862> pit<WH875>.
Yea <WH693>, she lieth in wait as a robber<WH2863>, And increaseth<WH3254> the treacherous<WH898> among men<WH120>.
Who hath woe<WH188>? who hath sorrow<WH17>? who hath contentions<WH4079>? Who hath complaining<WH7879>? who hath wounds<WH6482> without cause<WH2600>? Who hath redness<WH2448> of eyes<WH5869>?
They that tarry long<WH309> at the wine<WH3196>; They that go<WH935> to seek<WH2713> out mixed wine<WH4469>.
Look <WH7200> not thou upon the wine<WH3196> when it is red<WH119>, When it<WH5414> sparkleth<WH5869> in the cup<WH3563>, When it goeth<WH1980> down smoothly<WH4339>:
At the last<WH319> it biteth<WH5391> like a serpent<WH5175>, And stingeth<WH6567> like an adder<WH6848>.
Thine eyes<WH5869> shall behold<WH7200> strange things<WH2114>, And thy heart<WH3820> shall utter<WH1696> perverse things<WH8419>.
Yea <WH7901>, thou shalt be as he that lieth down in the midst<WH3820> of the sea<WH3220>, Or as he that lieth<WH7901> upon the top<WH7218> of a mast<WH2260>.

They have stricken<WH5221> me<WH2470>, shalt thou say, and I was not hurt; They have beaten<WH1986> me<WH3045>, and I felt it not<WH6974>: When shall I awake? I will seek<WH1245> it yet again<WH3254>.
